metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript Output
JavaScript Display Possibilities
JavaScript can "display" data in different ways:
content.html: JavaScript can "display" data in different ways:

content.text: Using innerHTML
To access an HTML element, you can use the document.getElementById(id) method.
content.html: To access an HTML element, you can use the document.getElementById(id) method.

content.text: Use the id attribute to identify the HTML element.
content.html: Use the id attribute to identify the HTML element.

content.text: Then use the innerHTML property to change the HTML content of the HTML element:
content.html: Then use the innerHTML property to change the HTML content of the HTML element:

content.code:
My First Web Page

My First Paragraph
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h1>My First Web Page</h1>
<p>My First Paragraph</p>

<p id="demo"></p>

<script>
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = "<h2>Hello World</h2>";
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Note
Changing the innerHTML property of an HTML element is the most common way to display data in HTML.
content.html: Changing the innerHTML property of an HTML element is the most common way to display data in HTML.

content.text: Using innerText
To access an HTML element, use the document.getElementById(id) method.
content.html: To access an HTML element, use the document.getElementById(id) method.

content.text: Then use the innerText property to change the inner text of the HTML element:
content.html: Then use the innerText property to change the inner text of the HTML element:

content.code:
My First Web Page

My First Paragraph
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h1>My First Web Page</h1>
<p>My First Paragraph</p>

<p id="demo"></p>

<script>
document.getElementById("demo").innerText = "Hello World";
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Note
Use innerHTML when you want to change an HTML element.
content.html: Use innerHTML when you want to change an HTML element.

content.text: Use innerText when you only want to change the plain text.
content.html: Use innerText when you only want to change the plain text.

content.text: Using document.write()
For testing purposes, it is convenient to use document.write() :
content.html: For testing purposes, it is convenient to use document.write():

content.code:
My First Web Page

My first paragraph.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h1>My First Web Page</h1>
<p>My first paragraph.</p>

<script>
document.write(5 + 6);
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Using document.write() after an HTML document is loaded, will delete all existing HTML :
content.html: Using document.write() after an HTML document is loaded, will delete all existing HTML:

content.code:
My First Web Page

My first paragraph.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h1>My First Web Page</h1>
<p>My first paragraph.</p>

<button type="button" onclick="document.write(5 + 6)">Try it</button>

</body>
</html>

content.text: The document.write() method should only be used for testing.
content.html: The document.write() method should only be used for testing.

content.text: Using window.alert()
You can use an alert box to display data:
content.html: You can use an alert box to display data:

content.code:
My First Web Page

My first paragraph.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h1>My First Web Page</h1>
<p>My first paragraph.</p>

<script>
window.alert(5 + 6);
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: You can skip the window keyword.
content.html: You can skip the window keyword.

content.text: In JavaScript, the window object is the global scope object. This means that variables, properties, and methods by default belong to the window object. This also means that specifying the window keyword is optional:
content.html: In JavaScript, the window object is the global scope object. This means that variables, properties, and methods by default belong to the window object. This also means that specifying the window keyword is optional:

content.code:
My First Web Page

My first paragraph.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h1>My First Web Page</h1>
<p>My first paragraph.</p>

<script>
alert(5 + 6);
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Using console.log()
For debugging purposes, you can call the console.log() method in the browser to display data.
content.html: For debugging purposes, you can call the console.log() method in the browser to display data.

content.text: You will learn more about debugging in a later chapter.
content.html: You will learn more about debugging in a later chapter.

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<script>
console.log(5 + 6);
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: JavaScript Print
JavaScript does not have any print object or print methods.
content.html: JavaScript does not have any print object or print methods.

content.text: You cannot access output devices from JavaScript.
content.html: You cannot access output devices from JavaScript.

content.text: The only exception is that you can call the window.print() method in the browser to print the content of the current window.
content.html: The only exception is that you can call the window.print() method in the browser to print the content of the current window.

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<button onclick="window.print()">Print this page</button>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is NOT a correct syntax for writing output in JavaScript?
content.html: What is NOT a correct syntax for writing output in JavaScript?
